title: Hurricane Erin reaches wind speeds of up to 160mph near Caribbean
description: The hurricane strengthened from a tropical storm to a Category 5 in just 24 hours, before weakening slightly to a Category 4.
content:
A hurricane making its way past the Caribbean Sea has quickly turned into a major storm, after rapidly strengthening in just 24 hours.
Hurricane Erin - the first of the 2025 Atlantic season - raced from maximum sustained winds of 100mph (160kph) to h... [2622 chars]

title: Israeli military preparing to expel Gaza City residents as baby in tent among those killed in latest attacks
description: Military claims it is displacing population ‘to ensure their safety’ even as health officials report deadly attacks on previously designated safe zones
content: The Israeli military will begin preparing for the forcible displacement of Palestinians from Gaza City, it said on Saturday, as health officials said it had killed at least 40 people including a baby in a tent and people seeking aid in its latest att... [6004 chars]

title: Yvette Cooper defends Palestine Action ban as 60 more faces charges
description: She writes in the Observer that the group is more than "a regular protest group known for occasional stunts".
content:
More than 700 people have been arrested since the group was banned by the government on 5 July - including more than 500 at a demonstration in central London last week.
On Saturday, Norfolk Police arrested 13 people accused of supporting the group, a... [1181 chars]

title: Publishers issue warning on AI-created books imitating sports autobiographies
description: Sky News has spent months tracking apparent AI recreations, particularly sports books, that have been sold on Amazon as Kindle e-books, as well as printed versions.
content:
The publishing industry has warned that books created by artificial intelligence - often imitating autobiographies - are a growing concern, and called on retailers to issue clearer warnings to consumers.
